abstract: A collection of state exported by the focused scene or view and its ancestors.
overview:
## Creating Custom Focused Values

Use the `Entry` macro to create custom focused values by extending `FocusedValues` with new properties:

The `Entry` macro automatically generates the underlying key type and provides the getter and setter for the focused value. Since the default value for focused values is always `nil`, all focused values must be optional.

### Publishing Values in Your Views

Views publish focused values using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/focusedValue(_:_:)] modifier:

For scene-wide values that should be available depending on the focused scene, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/focusedSceneValue(_:_:)]:

### Accessing the current focused value

Use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FocusedValue] property wrapper in your [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/App] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View] to read the current value in the `body`. The [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FocusedBinding] can be used as a convenient way to access the `wrappedValue` if the value type of the focused value is a `Binding`:

items.description: Reads and writes values associated with a given focused value key.

items.description: Sets the focused value for the given object type at a scene-wide scope.
items.name: focusedSceneValue(_:)

items.description: Modifies this view by injecting a value that you provide for use by other views whose state depends on the focused scene.
